definition: satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
(experienced action marker)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
and/moreover/yet/for the time being/to be about to/both (... and...)
(experienced action marker)
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: He lives in a shiftless way.
sentences.chinese: 他過着得過且過的日子。

sentences.english: For the past few decades, we have been able to be wasteful and get by.
sentences.chinese: 在過去的幾十年裏，我們鋪張浪費，得過且過。

sentences.english: The third option is to muddle through, shedding a few duds and tolerating the rest.
sentences.chinese: 第三種選擇是得過且過，裁掉幾個庸才，容忍其他的。

sentences.english: But all had a sense of fatalism.
sentences.chinese: 但所有人都變成了得過且過的宿命論者。

sentences.english: Sum of grief and sadness, and sometimes equal and just warm.
sentences.chinese: 悲傷和悲傷相加，有時等於得過且過的溫暖。

definition: lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to feel disheartened
unlucky
(Buddhism) retribution/karma
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to work to no avail (idiom)
lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
bottomless pit
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
to work hard
penniless
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
